content: In this case, you are filtering finset.range x, hence (finset.range x).filter (\lam k, condition k)

If you want to keep the set-notation I guess you could define your set as a set first, prove that it is a subset of finset.range x, use set.finite.subset to to show it's finite, and then use set.finite.to_finset. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
This will put you into noncomputable territory though.
OK great @Mario Carneiro 's suggestion seems to work... except it seems I need to show that condition is a decidable predicate?
if you don't want to bother with that then open_locale classical
which also puts you in noncomputable territory, of course
